title: How to Get a Founders' Hat on Animal Jam

steps.headline: Know what a Founders' Hat is worth.
steps.description: This will help you know what you need to trade for before attempting to get one. A founders' hat is worth 2 good long collars, either 2 blue, 2 purple, 2 red, or a mix, depending on the Jammer. Founders' hats, more accurately however, are worth 2 purple longs, though some people would like to get rid of their founders' hat fast or they want the most value for it possible, hence you may see some Jammers asking for blue longs or red longs. However, demand is low, which decreases an item's rarity slightly. So it's best if you avoid trading two red longs since technically it's an overtrade, and instead, go for two purple longs or a purple and a red long.

steps.headline: Decide what you will trade for the Founders' Hat before you begin building up to those items.
steps.description: Some Jammers want variety - a variety of spikes, an elf tail armor, a neon bow, and some spikes, etc. Some Jammers just want spikes - perhaps good longs or bad longs. Decide what you want to build up to. A lot of people enjoy trades with variety, but a lot of people also like trades purely made up of spikes. Decide what you think will be easier and trade up to those items. If you think you'll have a better chance finding a person who wants spikes for their Founders' Hat, trade for spikes. If you think most people want variety, aim for getting a variety of items that you can trade.

steps.headline: Begin building up.
steps.description:
If you don't already have the worth of a Founders' Hat, begin by getting a few small rares such as clothing betas, rare nature items, etc. Trade these items for den betas or rarer items if you're lucky such as spiked collars. You can obtain these small items through a number of ways - if you're non member, play the hard modes of adventures such as Return of the Phantoms and The Phantom Portal and grind these adventures to get as many clothing betas as you can. If you're member, try doing the Forgotten Desert over and over again to try to get small rares or even rarer items such as long collars. If you're non member and you want to get rares faster from land adventures, try creating 3 other backup accounts to use with your main so that if you get a good item from one chest, you can get it again from each of your backup accounts. If you get a bad item from a chest, you can still use your other accounts to test the other two clothing chests, so you can get 2 to 4 good items from these adventures at once. Plus, if you have a member account or friend to help you, you can open the animal passages within the adventure and have more chances at getting rare items with your backups. In total, you have 8 chances at getting good items if you're using your main and 3 backups. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e4\/Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.11.29-PM.png\/460px-Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.11.29-PM.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e4\/Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.11.29-PM.png\/759px-Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.11.29-PM.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":281,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":463.5164835164835,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Grinding the Forgotten Desert is a great way to begin if you're member. Not only can you get decent clothing betas and den betas from this adventure, but you can also get spikes, including long collars. If you get lucky and get 2 good long collars, preferably purple or red, you can trade those straight away for a Founders' Hat. Otherwise, keep building up using the items you obtain from this adventure. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/48\/Wateringcan.png\/460px-Wateringcan.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/48\/Wateringcan.png\/759px-Wateringcan.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":280,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":462.4725274725275,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Trade up clothing betas for den betas.
steps.description:
You can use these den betas to trade for spikes or other good larger rares which can be used eventually to trade for a Founders' Hat. Keep in mind that 1 member den beta is worth 2 clothing betas and a non member den beta is worth 3 to 4, depending on how big the clothing beta is. E.g. 3 worns for a non member den beta or 4 fox hats for one. Aim to get non member den betas as they will be more preferable to member ones when you trade them for spikes or other rares. Remember that a non member den beta is not worth 2 member den betas contrary to popular belief. If you want to trade member den betas for non member ones, trade one member den beta and a clothing beta for a non member den beta and no more. Non member den betas are worth 1.5 member den betas, i.e. a member den beta and a clothing beta. Avoid trading any more than that as this is a waste of rarity and unfair profit for the other trader. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2b\/Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.14.16-PM.png\/460px-Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.14.16-PM.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2b\/Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.14.16-PM.png\/760px-Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.14.16-PM.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":274,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":452.032967032967,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Keep doing adventures if you still need more items to trade up. You can get den betas straight from the Forgotten Desert as well, and using backups, you can get several clothing betas from non member adventures at once. Try to save up 40 den betas. This may seem like it will take a while, but it can go by fast if you grind enough adventures and trade long enough. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5b\/Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.15.50-PM.png\/460px-Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.15.50-PM.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5b\/Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.15.50-PM.png\/759px-Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.15.50-PM.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":280,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":462.4725274725275,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Trade those den betas for spikes.
steps.description:
A Founders' Hat is worth 2 good longs, usually 2 purple longs or a purple and a red long, depending on the Jammer. Try to avoid trading 2 red longs because this is considered over since a Founders' Hat has low demand. However, if you're having trouble finding a Jammer who wants otherwise, you can trade for 2 red longs and then trade those for the Founders' Hat if you want. Avoid aiming for blue longs - people rarely want the lowest good long for items as they are hard to trade away unless you add a large over to the blue long, which will eat away at your rarity instead of helping you work up to your goals or getting profit. Trade your den betas directly for red or purple longs. Don't trade your den betas for small spikes and then trade those spikes for longs. This is why it is recommended to save up 40 den betas, unless you can trade other shorts, neon bows, or other good items for these longs already, and you can add den betas as needed. The reason why you should not trade for smaller spikes first is because you'll be trading more den betas or items than you need to. A red long is worth 23 to 25 den betas. If you trade 16 den betas for 2 pink longs, this will add up to 32 den betas. Trading those pink longs for a red long means you'll have traded an extra 12 den betas for the long for nothing. This is just the way to rarity system is built in the game, so make smart choices when you're trading small base items like den betas and clothing betas. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b0\/Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.20.01-PM.png\/460px-Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.20.01-PM.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b0\/Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.20.01-PM.png\/760px-Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.20.01-PM.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":273,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":450.989010989011,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Use other items, if you have any, directly for purple or red longs as well. Again, this is due to the same reason discussed above. If you have plenty of short collars, neon bows and arrows, black worn blankets, wood floors, etc. you can also trade a mixture of those items or some of those rares as well as den betas for longs as well. The process may go faster if you already have good longs or if you obtain spikes from the Forgotten Desert. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c3\/Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.18.43-PM.png\/460px-Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.18.43-PM.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c3\/Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.18.43-PM.png\/760px-Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.18.43-PM.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":273,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":450.989010989011,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Trade these den betas or other rares you have collected, such as shorts or neon bows, for other items if you want.
steps.description: Founders' Hats may also be worth items such as certain beta elf tail armors, an orange party hat, etc. If you would like to build up to these items and then trade these for the Founders' Hat, you can do that as well. Remember the trading methods discussed above however. Keep in mind, also, the demand of each item. Both a Founders' Hat and an orange party hat are worth 2 good longs. But an orange party hat has slightly more demand than the hat, and therefore, the orange party hat is slightly rarer. If you're okay with slightly overtrading, you can do so. Elf tail armor has about the same demand as a Founders', so you can trade a purple elf tail armor (also worth 2 good longs) for one and not worry about being over.

steps.headline: Trade your good longs for a Founders' Hat.
steps.description:
Find a Jammer who wants to get rid of their Founders' Hat and provide them with your offer of two good longs. Remember, if you're fine with trading two red longs, go ahead. If you can negotiate a fairer, lower trade, that will be better. If you can find someone who wants two blue longs for their Founders' Hat, that's even better. Make the trade once you negotiate, if necessary. People usually want over trades. If someone wants two purple longs and wants you to add a few den betas, that's okay since you are trading for something with a higher rarity than two good longs. Try to avoid overtrading by anymore than a decent short collar for this item however, since this item is in low demand and shouldn't be worth anymore than its established rarity. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/08\/Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.24.09-PM.png\/460px-Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.24.09-PM.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/08\/Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.24.09-PM.png\/759px-Screen-Shot-2020-01-19-at-8.24.09-PM.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":271,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":447.85714285714283,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
